reviews.review_msg: Professor Mike's class is an information overload, but using Unstuckstudy alongside the lectures and studying hard can help you do well. Exams are fair, if tough. Definitely attend class!

Professor Mike's class is a lot of work, but using tools like Unstuck AI alongside the lectures can really help. Be ready to memorize details, but the exams are fair if you put in the time to study. Not the most engaging lectures, but worth pushing through.

you need to go to lectures to do well. firstly he gave quizzes at the end of every lecture and before too. his tests he will bring up something random he said during lecture and put it on there, but he also does ask for question to put on tests from students and does a handful of them. labs were easy. mike lectures just werent all that great tbh

Mike's lectures can be hard to follow, but so long as you make an effort to take notes and ask questions, you'll do alright. You will likely face a few surprises in the exams, but they are definitely fair. This course is very information-heavy, so pay attention and study outside class, and you'll do alright. [but fr, do study outside of class]

overall good proff. he includes tons of info in lec but so does every other stem proff and as a HSCI major this was not that bad. I did put lots of time towards this but I do that anyways. Although he adds lots of info to lec's, the MT/Finals are VERY BRIEF STUFF. I did wayyy too much studying for this course. exams are super light. good man

I would've preferred lecture slides with more words than just images. LOTS of memorizing tidbits of information, lots of time put into the course, but the midterms are fair. This course is information overload but I'd highly recommend it for any student doing sciences since the material expands all across the board. Lectures are very fast-paced!!

BPK142 is honestly one of the most difficult courses I have taken at SFU, because of Mike. Although he is very fast with answering emails, and gives straight forward answers he includes the most random information on his slides and expects you to memorize it for tests. Brags about his accomplishments too much to teach sometimes.

I am not sure how he is still teaching fr. He gives students a crap tonna information and expects us to memorize the most useless parts of it. He brags about himself all the time and most of the marking apparently depends on your TAs so if you end up with a strict one like me you'll end up failing 3/4 of the exams. So get a guy TA.

Everything about this course is torture. Be prepared to memorize a crap load of content because he expects you to know the smallest details of his lecture notes, powerpoints, and the lab manual (I mean it). Exams are full of fill in the blanks, short & long answer questions (no mcq).

I was scared taking a course with Dr. Walsh prior to this class. However, he is one of the most kindest and most understandable profs that I have ever had. His lecture materials is kind of disorganized(there is bunch of information on PP, word, video)but he puts an effort to teach and he is always accessible outside of the class or office hours.

I may be an outlier because I actually liked prof Walsh. I've heard some pretty negative things among peers but I found this course really interesting, he provided lots of material (powerpoints, docs and extra videos) to help me better understand the material. I think Mike is a decent prof though his exams are challenging but you can find success.

His redeeming quality is he's a funny guy. His teaching sucks. He uses a textbook, manual, videos, PPTs and Word docs that don't match up with each other. So much work. I made sure to email my TA wayyy before deadlines for clarification, she saved me from his careless & unclear instructions. I enjoyed the content but wouldn't reccommend this prof.

Hilarious guy that gets along with all the students and tries to explain the concepts in a simple manner for it to be easier to digest. Class has a lot of info but the tests are easy enough to get through. Very much high school gym teacher energy

He's a horrible teacher, but he does know his stuff. He seems passionate about it, he's often funny, and he's a pretty chill guy. I've talked to him outside of class and he's really great as a person, just not a lecturer. I will say that he does make time for students outside of class. He's just a horrible or the worst explainer.

Get ready for 5hr studying per week, tightening the f out of those hamstrings, and prepare to learn every detail down to a t and strength those neuro connections. O boi this is still mid-quarter I'm already burnt out.

I don't know why he gets such a hard rep., the guy really cares and sets students up to succeed. He's quiz heavy but they're not worth all that much, the point is to constantly check your knowledge. He's quite funny and very understanding if you approach him. His reviews scared me, but DON'T worry, approach it with an open mind, he's delightful.

Very mixed feelings about him. He's funny and he knows his stuff, clearly cares about the topics he's teaching. However, his teaching style needs support, there are endless quizzes without adequate time, labs are not at all well made for online. I don't think he put in any effort to make the online experience a good one. It became awkward a lot.

Unfortunately, as much as I would like to avoid Mike Walsh in the future, he does teach a lot of upper year BPK classes. This class was just memorization- remember your lecture notes inside and out, and your lab manual. His exams are fill-in-the-blank and short answer. It felt like a lot of content to remember (and it was), so start early!

Made the lectures and topics more complicated than they are. STRICT marker! Expects you to remember the smallest details on his notes, also has fill in the blank questions on his tests, so unnecessary. Prepare to READ and MEMORIZE EVERYTHING. AVOID this prof at all cost.

take this class if youre willing to memorize handouts that are 3-11 pages word per word. if u have a question, have ur recorder ready coz he wont answer straight to the point. he expects u to know stuff. final and midterms would probably be easy if u were able to memorize his handouts down to the smallest detail. definitely not a gpa booster
Expects you to know the facts to the smallest detail,don't expect easy marking if you miss a word no marks. Avoid taking courses with this prof at all cost.

Doesnt answer question from students clearly. A close book. Brags a lot. Has to be EXACTLY the words he said on lecture or else you wont get a point even if you have the idea. Never taking another course with this prof.
If youre gonna take Kinesiology dont take it with him. Lectures are brutal and its impossible to memorize the material that he expects you to know.

The exam format is brutal, it is all fill in the blank for the lecture exams. He sometimes gets off topic and talks about himself too much. Otherwise he is a okay guy. Teacher wise though, I would not recommend him, or the course. It is not a GPA booster for sure.

took this last year, in the summer, and i gotta say dude was a solid prof, explained everything pretty well and added in his own humor plus he had interesting stories, which i liked. If you did ever have questions, you could always approach him after class, he was always up to help.

For some absurd reason Mikes class is a science elective. Unless you have at least SOME math / science background, DON'T take this class. He's nice and he is intelligent and knowledgeable. His test however ask questions that require you to know arbitrary concepts from his notes. you need to memorize EVERY SINGLE WORD of his note to pass his exams.

Dr. Walsh is just an amazing professor. Couldnt have asked for a better prof to be honest. He is so caring towards his students and he honestly provides so much help that it is extremely possible to get a good grade. Review his notes every week and youll do amazing. His exams are fair and he gives most of the written questions beforehand!

Mike is a really caring person. He is easy to get along with because he has a very cool attitude. However, you need to work hard to get a good grade. Dont fall behind in your lectures and youll do amazing on his exams which btw are fair but tough. He also gives some of the questions beforehand which helps a lot. Overall, an amazing prof!

Lectures are dry and very boring, he gets off topic very easily. Labs are fun. Exams are straight up memorizing from the notes, because they are all fill in the blank (so its very hard to get a good grade) I would avoid taking a class with him. Don't take this as an easy elective (it is the exact opposite), it is impossible to get a decent grade :(
hardest elective i've ever took. had the worst time. would not recommend

I wish Mike changed his formatting on tests. The fill in the blank portion is horrible in the sense that it tests your memorizing skills. He's a great prof... funny, intelligent and present when you need help. I just wish he changes a few things for future courses.

Awesome prof, just read his notes and powerpoints, and do the questions he gives out for you guys.  He literally tells you whats gonna be on exam.  If you study you will recieve an A that simple.  He is out there to help you as much as you are willing.  The labs are awesome very straight forward.  Rock on brother let the good times roll

Mike is awesome! He makes lectures interesting even though the material can be extremely dry. He gives clear instructions on how you'll be tested and what his expectations are. Make sure to study lots for this course because it is loaded with information.
Exams are directly from notes. Be sure to memorize everything, including the number values for things.

Mike's lectures and labs were fine and quite enjoyable with his sense of humour, but the exams were where he lost points. They are mostly fill in the blank questions word-for-word from the notes, which focus too much on small details and not enough on important things. Very toughly marked course. Would recommend taking this course with another prof

Although the course is very tough in terms of the amount of facts/concepts to remember, Mike does a great job of explaining them and making sure you understand them (given you ask for help). There's a lot of reading and memorizing, but if you work for it, the course teaches you a lot and is highly recommended with this prof.

Tough class to get a good grade. Lectures are dry, as well as the notes. Notes happen to be unclear and confusing. Exams are based word for word on the notes but don't make sense. labs are easy, but material is confusing and isn't explained properly (lab and lecture notes)

Great teacher. He likes to tell stories in class to keep lectures interesting. Tons of memorization but exams are fair, straight from the lecture notes and lab manual. He's very approachable and helpful so don't be afraid to go to office hours. Labs are simple and fun. It is NOT a hard class if you keep up! Took as an elective and did fine.

This is a worse course I have ever taken in my life. The TA sucks a lot. I don't prefer talking this course for elective since a LOT of memorization, well A LOT!!!!!!!! The midterm and final are hard af!

I just want to say I was very happy to take this course with Craig before he retired. He really is passionate about Kin and while other may find him boring by getting off topic with stories or articles that was the only reason i still came to class! Obviously being a Kin major I'm biased but this has been my favorite class to date.

Such a great prof.  Absolute no complaints here.  Final and midterm were so fair and so easy if you keep up.  Content was so interesting especially the last lectures about altitude physiology and underwater physiology.  I loved the stories he gave.  He had a great sense of humor and you could tell he really loves the subject.

In lecture Craig mostly read off of the slides, told a few stories about this adventures (awesome) and got off task a lot, but overall he was a great Prof. The content was not too much, you just have to put in the work to get the grade you want, the Labs we're so much fun, and the exams were not too difficult. i would recommend this class!!

although he's a very nice guy who likes to crack a few jokes during lecture, his class is pretty boring overall. he literally reads off the notes and barely adds anything to it so there really is no point in going to class. the midterms and final are straight off lecture notes and lab manual so just memorize everything on there and you're good

After the midterms and the finals, I feel that going to class isn't really that necessary, though it does help with retaining some information. His exams are straight forward with no trick questions, but there may be questions that will make you think a little bit and apply your understanding of the course material. Overall I would recommend him

Craigs lectures are a huge waste of time. He reads directly off notes, and he brings up irrelevant stories each class. Attendance is definitely not mandatory; I skipped 80% of the lectures and still got 98% on the midterm easily. Labs are helpful though.

Amazing prof!! He's super fair and lets you know exactly what is expected of you.  You won't go into an exam unsure of what is on it.  Labs are super helpful and if you study and learn all the material, this class is a good gpa booster.

Pretty great prof. Lectures aren't bad-depends on what you're learning. Some lectures he makes interesting & others are a bore. He's good when it comes to outlining criteria. You know exactly what he expects of you. Going to the lab is more important than the lecture. Not a difficult course, but don't slack off either.  Exams are fair so study.

Awesome professor! Tells you exactly what he expects on exams. Eg. Lecture exams are straight out of lecture notes... same thing with labs. Everything you need to know to do well is in the notes which is great because there are NO surprises on the test.

Don't take any classes with Craig if you can avoid it. He just goes off on tangents and doesn't address any course content and then puts it all on the exam. The class is easy but it's turned me off taking any BPK courses in the future
Nice guy, bad prof. Doesn't lecture about the actual course content at all, so don't bother coming to lecture. Trust me, you won't miss anything.

This class is hard. I got a C+. Class is not mandatory and labs are. You have weekly assignments and study questions for each week. The exams in lecture come from all the notes (lots of notes) so you have t do a lot of memorizing of some difficult concepts.

Amazing prof. Lectures were not mandatory but I still went to every one as he made them so interesting. Even though he does go off on a tangent often, his lectures still help with understanding of notes. Lots of memorization for midterm/final. Labs are fun and  easy. Lab MT and final are straight from practice q's.

He's very funny and entertaining.  Lecture recordings and notes are all posted online so attending lectures are optional.  Lecture exams are fair and straight-forward; you just have to memorize the lecture notes.  Labs are fun and easy.  Lab exams were easy but the anatomy exam was confusing (only worth 10% though.)  Overall, a great class.
Don't even need to go to class. Lectures are all online. Exam is straight out of lecture notes. TA's are the best for this course. Clear expectations of students.

He connects the lectures to real life. He lectures in an interesting story-telling style. Makes jokes and includes funny pictures in lecture slides. Very helpful when you go to his office hours for help or remarking. He often shows us interesting articles and he got a section for them on Canvas.

Craig was a great professor. Lectures were interesting and he was definitely energetic about his field. The lab test questions were provided in the lab manual so there were no surprises. He was also constantly available and was flexible with his hours. If I could take the course again, I would.
The key to this class is to memorize everything and do all the study questions!

the best TA i've ever had. definitely try to get him for bpk 142 if you can. the material/course would not have been as enjoyable without him. makes the subjects easy to learn and is very knowledgable.

Super glad I had Brent as my TA for my first semester at SFU! He explains information clearly and makes sure we are understanding the material as he goes along. He also gives lots of tips which helped me through the entire term!

It was my first semester here at SFU and Brent was the best TA I've had. He replied to emails immediately, he was knowledgeable about the topic, and most importantly he was super caring. I got a C in this class, which was totally my fault, and plus it was my first year so I was still getting used to the environment.
Brent is hands down the best TA Ive ever met. He replied to emails really quickly and he just made the class more enjoyable
BEST TA EVER. Engaging and funny, might go on tangents however, is caring and wants to help you succeed.
Good online labs

Best TA at SFU hands down! Brent has an amazing knowledge of the course material and can help you with any questions you have. He replies to emails within hours and his review sessions are fantastic. Grading is super fair and so were his labs. Easy A if you put in the time and effort.

Such an amazing TA. This guy knows his stuff and is more than willing to help his students learn. He is extremely accessible, genuinely, caring kind, funny and helpful. By far the best TA I have ever had.

The fact that all he's one of the highest rated profs at sfu without actually being a prof says a lot about his teaching abilities. Learned a lot from him and I never felt intimidated approaching him or anything. Literally the Greatest TA at SFU

A perfect world would be if I had Brent teach all my courses. He is better than ANY profs that I have had at my career at SFU. Someone make this guy a prof considering he's better than any professors around despite being a TA.
Best TA a first-year could hope for. Fun, relaxed, educational, fair, engaging, and still professional. He made the labs interesting and active to the point that I'd look forward to them. Legend.
Just a great TA all around and an even better guy. He's very engaging and is always willing to take the extra time to make sure you understand what's going on in class. Absolute legend!
great guy, passionate and engaging, lectures were a lot of fun

Brent was the greatest TA ever. I'm going to miss having a lab with him. And I typically don't like labs but he makes labs fun. Also, he opened up office hours up until 15 minutes before the exam, so it was nice to have the opportunity to go ask all the last minute questions I had. Overall, Amazing. Why is he not a Professor yet?

All these amazing ratings here aren't exaggerations. I love this guy. He's got so much knowledge and you can tell that he's passionate about what he's doing. And he has such a distinctive personality that it shines through even when he's sending out emails. Best TA I've ever had.

Best TA ever. Was very accessible outside of class, even changed his office hours once he realized nobody in his lab could make them. He was extremely kind and gave very good constructive criticism on lab procedures, and his examples of concepts were very clear. Very awesom and would 100% take a class with him again.

Brent is one of the greatest TA's there is. I would change my entire schedule around if it meant having him as a TA for one of my course. He is super knowledgeable (any question I had regarding the course, he answered it along with other supplemental information that I found very useful). He's better than all my profs right now. he should be a prof

The endless perfect reviews on here aren't a lie. Brent is one the best TA's SFU has to offer and is the best TA I have ever had. Not only is he approachable, personable and makes everyone feel comfortable, but he is also extremely knowledgeable and great at explaining things. He never didn't have a great answer to a question. Should be a prof!
The GOAT

Best TA ever. Engages students and explains topics in a way that is easy to understand but doesn't talk down to you. Super enthusiastic and always ready to help. Would rearrange schedule to have him be the TA if is was at all possible.
super duper approachable and knowledgeable. He'll never look down on you no matter what questions you ask him. Super helpful and is very good at explaining things in an easy to relate way
Brent is the best! He is so helpful, approachable and VERY knowledgeable!!!!

He's an expert in his field, and he provided supplementary info not found in the lab manuals - this, along with the fact that he would make everyone feel safe and included, has made Brent the best TA I've had so far. He'd make an exceptional prof, and isn't arrogant at all - you feel more like you're talking to a good friend who sees you likewise.
Good
So glad I took this course. Brent is a kind heart, and easy on the eyes. Very thorough and never condescending.

One of the COOLEST and MOST RAD TA's ever. Any questions you have he is always open to answer and really knows his stuff. It's easy to tell he's passionate about what he teaches and definitely made the anatomy and labs super enjoyable to learn! If you get him as your BPK 142 TA you'll have no problem!
Best TA I've ever had.
THE. BEST. He is able to answer your questions straightforwardly, unlike most TAs, and he is so informative. Always there if you needed help
great lab ta. very understanding and easy to approach for help. lab material takes a lot of reading to memorize/get but it's generally not that bad. lab assignments were ok too

Amazing at explaining concepts, is both kind yet stern when it matters. People say shes a tough marker but if they actually see where and why they were marked wrong, they can see that her marking is both fair and justifiable. Also has a fun and unique sense of humour.

I'm a BPK major and I absolutely loved this course.  His lectures were engaging and I learned so much from him!  For a level-100 science course,  the course load was light and the exams were fairly easy as long as you study a decent amount. However, if you are not a science major student, you may find this course slightly difficult.

Best prof to take BPK 142 with. Lectures have lots of info but he presents it clear and heavily hints at exam questions & basically tells you exactly what to study. Lectures can be a bit long but he does make it interesting. The labs are a good grade boost. Make sure to take lots of time to review as it is a lot of material.

His lectures are clear and easy to follow. There is a lot of content in his slides so get ready to take notes and review every week. He also has lecture and lab quizzes so make sure to pay attention to his lectures. The marking for exams and labs are a bit tough, if you consistently review each topic you should be fine. Overall, approachable prof.
Ask him questions and he'll answer in quite a simple way. Somewhat funny as well.

His lectures are engaging however they are very long and can be draining. There's a good balance of heavy and light content that he covers. Lecture exams were very difficult because there is a lot of content you need to remember. Lab exams were more manageable. His slides and notes were very good for studying.
I love him! he's such a great prof and engaging! explains things in depth and well.

studying as you go is the key to this class, don't fall behind or you'll get overwhelmed. i wouldn't recommend this as an elective (unless you like anatomy) as there's so much content to cover. jim is a great lecturer and explains things very well. definitely go to your TA if you need any help!! [fall 2021]
The online course format was not supportive for students

Professor Carter was kind but not a great teacher. The lectures consisted of him saying the same stuff he already said in very long videos he had already posted before in which he would just read off the slides. The class was cool but was not very engaging which did not help with staying productive throughout the course.
I took BPK 142 with professor Carter, he is truly passionate about what he teaches which made his classes very enjoyable. I loved the labs and the physiology portion of his class. Great prof

amazing professor. he explains things very well both in lec and the prerecorded vids. you can get by without even going to lec and just reading the provided notes and slides, however there are poll and post lec q's for small participation marks. def study bc it's quite a hard course. i don't recommend this as an elective.
i think hes a pretty fair marker and the exams arent too bad. you just need to memorize everything on the summary sheet for the exams.
Jim is a great guy, had Tiffany and Brent as T.A, they were also extremely helpful and attentive. Great materials.

He was probably one of the best profs I have ever had and he made 8:30 am lectures interesting. I would highly recommend taking bpk 142 with him as he made a relatively difficult course much more manageable.

This course is probably one of the hardest and heaviest course and I've grind through and i've done very well in 200 courses. The amount of materials covered is insane for a 3-credit 100 course and gave me more panic and stress than calc and physics combined.
Explains concepts clearly and is a well respected professor. BPK 142 is not an easy class and has a lot of content, but if you study regularly, it's not too difficult to get a good grade

Dr. Carter was absolutely fantastic! His lectures are clear, concise and very organized much like the rest of the course. You have to review the material regularly (I suggest making flashcards and looking at them everyday) to do well and make sure not to cram before the tests. If you're diligent with studying the material, an A isn't hard at all.

BPK 142 is a dense course, and Jim understands that. He'll give you information on how to study during the midterm and exams. He's knowledgeable, and gives interesting lecture, even at 8:30 am. No textbook was needed. Study the lecture slides provided, and study for that lab midterm. A lot of people did badly on the lab midterm. Good luck

Truly passionate about the course material. He is very knowledgable as well. The lectures are amazing, but TA's have too much control over the grades you get. I didnt have a fair marking TA for this course, but Jim Carter himself is truly amazing. I would love to take another course with him if I could.
Great Prof. Fair exams. Nice Person. Makes the class very straightforward

Jim is by far one of the best profs I have had at sfu. He tells you what information is going to be on the midterm and isn't actually lying like most other profs. He had notes of his lectures that contain all the testable material in the class. Very knowledgeable about the content and lectures are very much worth going to. A god amongst men.

Jim is a clear and passionate professor towards the class material! The iclicker questions are for participation marks only, often relating to daily life outside the classroom. Exams were fair. However, there is a lot of material covered in the lecture and lab finals. Definitely study ahead!
Good prof with interesting lectures. He makes the material relatable, which helps. No surprises on the midterm and final exams, just a lot of content to memorize.
Amazing prof! He's really engaging and there are no surprises in the lecture and lab midterms or finals. The lecture final and midterm have lots of list type questions that are easy marks to get!

Jim was an amazing lecturer and made me motivated to come to class. His lectures were always organised and went along well with the lab component.  We were told exactly what to expect from assessments, and if you did the work for the class were very straightforward.  I highly recommend taking this course with Jim if you have the opportunity.
LOVE.

He says in lecture that the only thing he will test you on are the notes he provides. This is technically true, however in his tests he expects much more detail in the answer than the question would imply. So it's a good idea to, once you think you're done the test, go back through it and add things, even if you think they would be obvious.
Pretty good prof that tries to make lectures interesting and fun :) Midterm was surprising and not as in depth as expected.
